introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.text: Welcome to Scrum Poker. By using this application, you agree to these Terms of Service. Please read them carefully before using the service.

usage.title: Use of Service
usage.text: Scrum Poker is a free tool for agile teams to conduct planning poker sessions. You may use this service for personal and commercial purposes in accordance with these terms.

account.title: User Sessions
account.text: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your session IDs. Sessions are temporary and data is not permanently stored.

limitations.title: Limitations of Liability
limitations.text: The service is provided 'as is' without any warranties. We are not liable for any damages arising from the use of this service.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.text: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.text: Your privacy is important to us. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use Scrum Poker.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.text: We collect minimal data necessary for the service to function: username (temporary), session data, and voting choices. This data is stored temporarily and deleted when sessions end.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.text: We use cookies to save your preferences such as language and theme settings. These cookies are stored locally in your browser.

dataUsage.title: Data Usage
dataUsage.text: Your data is used solely for providing the planning poker functionality. We do not sell, share, or use your data for marketing purposes.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us through our website.

ready.title: Before You Start Estimating
ready.text: Before estimating, make sure that the user story is 'ready' and was discussed with the team. A ready story should have clear acceptance criteria, be understood by all team members, and be small enough to complete within a sprint.

estimating.title: Estimating Using Scrum Poker
estimating.text: Each team member selects a card that represents their estimate of the effort required. Cards are kept hidden until everyone has voted, preventing bias. This tool helps facilitate this process in real-time with your remote team.

storyPoints.title: Understanding Story Points
storyPoints.text: Story points are an abstract measure representing the complexity of implementing a user story. They consider effort, risk, and uncertainty. The Fibonacci-like sequence (0.5, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13) reflects increasing uncertainty with larger tasks. The coffee cup (â˜•) means 'I need a break' or 'pass'.

results.title: Uncovering the Results
results.text: After everyone has voted, click 'Show Cards' to reveal all estimates. If they match, the story is successfully estimated! If estimates differ significantly, discuss the reasons - this often uncovers important details about the story.

importance.title: Why Estimation Matters
importance.text: Well-estimated stories help the product owner judge if the value of a feature is worth the complexity and effort to implement it. It also helps with sprint planning and setting realistic expectations with stakeholders.
